source.description: Pick where your data comes from, delivery or preview API
source.title: Source

rawData.description: Whether the data should be returned RAW instead of parsed
rawData.title: RAW Data

select.description: The select operator allows you to choose what fields to return from an entity. You can choose multiple values by combining comma-separated operators.
select.title: Fields

exclude.description: Search for all data that matches the condition: {attribute}[nin]={value}. Attribute can use dot notation.
exclude.title: Exclude

content_type.description: To search for entries with a specific content type
content_type.title: Content Type ID

include.description: Search for all data that matches the condition: {attribute}[in]={value}. Attribute can use dot notation.
include.title: Include

order.description: You can order items in the response by specifying the order search parameter. You can use sys properties (such as sys.createdAt) or field values (such as fields.myCustomDateField) for ordering.
order.title: Order

notEqual.description: Search for all data that matches the condition: {attribute}[ne]={value}. Attribute can use dot notation.
notEqual.title: Not Equal

equal.description: Search for all data that matches the condition: {attribute}={value}. Attribute can use dot notation.
equal.title: Equal

exist.description: Search for all data that matches the condition: {attribute}[exists]={value}. Attribute can use dot notation.
exist.title: Exist

rawData.description: Whether the data should be returned RAW instead of parsed
rawData.title: RAW Data

query.description: Full-text search is case insensitive and might return more results than expected. A query will only take values with more than 1 character.
query.title: Query
